data.title: The Killers, Babyface and more are headed to Southern California casinos next week
data.meta_description: See who else is scheduled to perform and find out how to get tickets to shows happening the week of Sept 18-24.
data.text:
Next week, Southern California casinos are hosting a Las Vegas-based rock band, a musician paying tribute to his late father, a comedian who is now a head writer on one of the longest-running sketch comedy shows on television, an R&B legend and a Mexican pop icon of the 2000s.

Be sure to check the official websites for the latest event information.

The Killers

The Killers is a rock band based out of Las Vegas. They started in the early ’00s and served as a contrast to other popular groups at the time that were riding the trends of nu-metal, punk and rap. The band got their name from a logo on the bass drum of a fictitious band portrayed in the music video for the New Order song “Crystal.” The band is known for the hits “Mr. Brightside,” “When You Were Young” and “All These Things That I Have Done.” 8 p.m. Thursday, Sept. 21 at Yaamava’ Resort & Casino, 777 San Manuel Blvd., Highland. Tickets start at $85; 21-and-older only. 909-864-5050. yaamava.com.

A.J. Croce

Adrian James “A.J.” Croce is the son of musician and folk singer Jim Croce, who died in a plane crash when A.J. was two years old. He picked up guitar and began writing music of his own and has since toured with artists like Willie Nelson, Lenny Kravitz and B.B. King. Croce will perform an intimate show in Rancho Mirage dubbed Croce Plays Croce. The evening will include a performance of his late father’s songs including “Operator,” “You Don’t Mess Around with Jim” and “Time in a Bottle.” 8 p.m. Friday, Sept. 22 at Agua Caliente Resort Casino Spa, 32-250 Bob Hope Drive, Rancho Mirage. $25-$75. 800-514-3849. aguacalientecasinos.com.

Sign up for our Casino Insider newsletter and get the week’s best bets for food, entertainment and fun at Southern California’s casinos. Subscribe here.

Babyface

Kenny Brian Edmonds, also known by his stage moniker, Babyface, is a 12-time Grammy award winner, singer, songwriter, and record producer specializing in R&B and soul. Funk bassist and songwriter Bootsy Collins gave the singer his stage name because of his youthful looks. Some of the singer’s most notable songs include “Every Time I Close My Eyes,” “Never Keeping Secrets” and “Hurt You.” 8 p.m. Sept. 22 at Harrah’s Resort Southern California, 777 S. Resort Drive, Valley Center. $69.50-$99.50, 18-and-older only. 760-751-3100. harrahssocal.com.

Colin Jost

Colin Jost is a comedian, actor and the current head writer of “Saturday Night Live.” He joined “Saturday Night Live” as a writer in 2005 and became a co-head writer in 2012. Jost has also co-hosted the “Weekend Update” since 2014 alongside fellow cast member and comedian, Michael Che. In 2015, Jost wrote “Staten Island Summer,” a coming-of-age comedy released by Paramount Pictures and produced by Lorne Michaels. He has since been seen in the films “How to Be Single,” “Coming 2 America” and “Tom and Jerry.” 8 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 23 at Pechanga Resort Casino, 45000 Pechanga Parkway, Temecula. Tickets start at $59.50. 877-711-2946. pechanga.com.

Paulina Rubio

Paulina Rubio is a Mexican singer, songwriter and television personality who got her big break as a member of the successful pop group Timbiriche. She later embarked on a solo career and became a pop icon and one the most influential women in Mexico. Rubio has also served as a coach on several iterations of the Spanish language reality competition show “La Voz” and as a judge on the American reality television competition show “The X Factor.” Some of Rubio’s hits include “Ni Una Sola Palabra,” “El Último Adiós” and “Ni Rosas Ni Juguetes.” 8 p.m. Sunday, Sept. 24 at Spotlight 29 Casino, 46-200 Harrison Place, Coachella. Tickets start at $35; 21-and-older only 760-775-5566. spotlight29.com.
